bill_title: include children with a hearing loss in the reporting criteria required for deaf and hard-of-hearing children.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to include children with a hearing loss in the reporting criteria required for deaf and hard-of-hearing children. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 13-33B-10 be AMENDED: 13-33B-10. Reporting criteria specific to language and literacy development. Before August 1, 2020, the department shall establish reporting criteria, using existing data reported in compliance with the federally required state performance plan on students with disabilities, that is specific to the language and literacy development of deaf and hard-of-hearing children from birth to five years of age, inclusive children from birth through age eighteen or through age twenty-one for any child still in high school, with a hearing loss. The reporting criteria shall be specific to any child who is deaf or hard-of-hearing regardless of whether the child is receiving special education or special education and related services or is receiving accommodations under section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.

An Act to include children with a hearing loss in the reporting criteria required for deaf and hard-of-hearing children. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 13-33B-10 be AMENDED: 13-33B-10. Reporting criteria specific to language and literacy development. Before August 1, 2020, the department shall establish reporting criteria, using existing data reported in compliance with the federally required state performance plan on students with disabilities, that is specific to language and literacy development of deaf and hard-of-hearing children from birth to five years of age, inclusive. Beginning on July 1, 2021, in conjunction with the department's annual collection of data on children with disabilities served, the department shall also annually report the number of enrolled students from birth to age twenty-one, regardless of disability status, who have a documented hearing loss of thirty-five decibels or more, unaided unilaterally or bilaterally. Section 2. That § 13-33B-11 be AMENDED: 13-33B-11. Implementation and application of §§ 13-33B-4 to 13-33B-10. The implementation of §§ 13-33B-4 to 13-33B-10, inclusive, shall be consistent with federal law regarding the education of children with disabilities and the privacy of student information. Sections 13-33B-4 to 13-33B-10 13-33B-9, inclusive, only apply to children from birth to five years of age.
